location_long_descr:
The garden of the Černín Palace in Prague, where the Ministry of Foreign Affairs is located, is open to the public during the busy tourist season. The originally Baroque garden was built at the end of the 17th century by prominent architects of the time. In the 19th century, the garden was transformed into an English park.
The Černín Garden covers an area of ​​1.7 hectares. Its creation dates back to the end of the 17th century. Several important architects of their time participated in the appearance of the garden -  Francesco Caratti, Domenico Rossi and František Maxmilián Kaňka , thanks to whom a new summer house was added there.
